hints.content:
We can think of $\purpleC{45}$ as $\purpleC{4\text{ tens}}$ and $\purpleC{5 \text{ ones}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{917}$ as $\blueD{9\text{ hundreds}}$, $\blueD{1\text{ ten}}$, and $\blueD{7\text{ ones}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{45}+\blueD{917}$

$=\purpleC{4\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{5\text{ ones}}+\blueD{9\text{ hundreds}}+\blueD{1\text{ ten}}+\blueD{7\text{ ones}}$

$= \blueD{9\text{ hundreds}}+\purpleC{4\text{ tens}}+\blueD{1\text{ ten}}+\purpleC{5\text{ ones}}+\blueD{7\text{ ones}}$
The answer: $9\text{ hundreds} + 4 \text{ tens}+1\text{ ten} +5 \text{ ones}+7 \text{ ones}$

question.content:
Marie isn't sure how to add $45+917$.

**Help Marie by choosing an addition problem that is  the same as $45+917$.**
